entries.title: Michelle Yeoh on how her Oscar-nominated role was first offered to Jackie Chan
entries.description: Oscar-nominated actress Michelle Yeoh speaks to CNN's Christiane Amanpour about her acclaimed film "Everything Everywhere All At Once" and her first reactions to the script.

entries.title: Officials have said that the balloon's path carries it over a 'number of sensitive sites' in the US
entries.description: As the US and its Canadian partners continue to monitor a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon floating above the northern United States, one question stands out among the rest: Why hasn't it been shot down?

entries.title: Photographers empower girls of color by reimagining Disney princesses
entries.description: CNN's Laura Coates joins two photographers from CreativeSoul Photography who've partnered with shopDisney to debut a new collection of magical dolls inspired by Disney princesses meant to empower young girls of color.

entries.title: Kate has worked out what will define her royal future
entries.description: There had been rumblings and whispers of something big coming from Kensington Palace. This week we finally found out exactly what's been in the works when Catherine, Princess of Wales unveiled a major new public awareness campaign centered around the importance of early childhood.

entries.title: Mafia boss found working as pizza boss after 16 years on the run
entries.description: Italian anti-Mafia police have arrested another mobster on the run, just two weeks after the sensational arrest on January 16 of Sicilian Cosa Nostra superboss Matteo Messina Denaro at a health clinic in Palermo, Sicily.

entries.title: Biden appears to back off vow to punish Saudi Arabia
entries.description: Several months after President Joe Biden promised Saudi Arabia would suffer "consequences" after the Saudi-led OPEC+ oil cartel unexpectedly announced it would cut production, the Biden administration has no plans to take proactive steps to punish -- let alone significantly reorient its posture toward -- the oil-rich Middle East kingdom, multiple sources on Capitol Hill and in the administration tell CNN.

entries.title: US Secretary of State pushes back his visit to Beijing in response to a suspected Chinese spy balloon flying over the US, officials say
entries.description: • China says balloon is for research and entered US after deviating from planned course

entries.title: Funeral director finds woman pronounced dead gasping for air in body bag
entries.description: An Iowa Alzheimer's care facility is facing a $10,000 fine after pronouncing a woman dead who was later found alive when a funeral director unzipped her body bag, according to documents from the Iowa Department of Inspections and Appeals.

entries.title: 'Extremely triggering': Police shooting survivors react to Tyre Nichols video
entries.description: The footage of Tyre Nichols' deadly police arrest is hard to watch, but for those who have survived brutal police encounters, it can be unbearable.

entries.title: New York's long-awaited 'bean' sculpture unveiled
entries.description: A large curvaceous, reflective sculpture by Anish Kapoor that was commissioned for a prominent street corner in Lower Manhattan back in 2008 has finally been completed. The yet-to-be-titled work, which shares many features with the British artist's iconic "Cloud Gate" sculpture in Chicago — known colloquially as "the bean" — is now shining crisply at the corner of Church and Leonard streets in Tribeca.

entries.title: Marlon Brando's breakup letter to girlfriend is up for sale
entries.description: A handwritten letter sent by a young Marlon Brando to break up with his French girlfriend in the late 1940s could fetch up to $15,000 at auction.

entries.title: 'The whole place shook': Man describes what it was like when Israeli military raided his home
entries.description: Tensions in the West Bank are high as violence between the Israeli military and Palestinians has ramped up in recent weeks. Last week, Israeli forces killed ten Palestinians and wounded several others in a raid on a refugee camp in the city of Jenin. CNN's Nic Robertson visits the scene of the raid and meets some of those whose homes were caught in the crossfire.

entries.title: Activision Blizzard settles SEC charges for $35 million
entries.description: Activision Blizzard will pay $35 million to settle US government allegations that the video game giant violated a whistleblower protection rule and lacked processes to collect workplace misconduct complaints, according to the Securities and Exchange Commission.

entries.title: Paco Rabanne, Spanish fashion designer known for his flamboyant creations, dies at 88
entries.description: World-famous fashion designer Paco Rabanne has died at the age of 88.

entries.title: China says balloon is for research and entered US after deviating from planned course
entries.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken has postponed his upcoming trip to China in response to the flying of a suspected Chinese spy balloon over the United States, according to two US officials. The postponement marks a significant new phase in the tensions between Washington and Beijing.

entries.title: How an 1800s surgeon experimenting on enslaved Black women affects anti-abortion
entries.description: In this episode of CNN's digital series, "History Refocused," Nicquel Terry Ellis outlines the anti-abortion movement's historical links to White supremacy and how the overturning of Roe v. Wade has reopened a conversation about racial equality.

entries.title: China says balloon is for research and entered US after deviating from planned course
Poker star uses Airtag to track bag lost in airport 'twilight zone'
entries.description: You check your luggage for a flight, but it doesn't appear on the carousel at your destination.

entries.title: Suspect arrested in case of tamarin monkeys missing from Dallas Zoo, police say
entries.description: A 24-year-old man has been arrested in Dallas and charged in connection with the suspected theft of a pair of emperor tamarin monkeys that were recovered unharmed this week in an abandoned home a day after they vanished from the Dallas Zoo, police said.

entries.title: Austin Butler's costar Dave Bautista says the Elvis accent isn't in 'Dune' sequel
entries.description: No need to be all shook up about Austin Butler's continuing to sound like Elvis Presley.

entries.title: Inside the 'Bentley' of luxury residential towers, opening in Miami
entries.description: The coastline of Sunny Isles Beach, Florida, will be getting a new addition in 2026: the sparkling exterior of Bentley Motors' first residential building, rising above a skyline full of luxury condos and hotels.

entries.title: Pope Francis arrives in South Sudan in historic trip
entries.description: Pope Francis arrived in Juba, South Sudan on Friday fulfilling a long-time wish to visit the war-ravaged country, currently in the midst of a major humanitarian emergency.

entries.title: Sorry, Spike. There's a new world's oldest living dog -- and he's the oldest ever recorded
entries.description: It was only two weeks ago that Spike, a 23-year-old chihuahua mix from Ohio, was named the oldest living dog. Now, he has been utterly dethroned.

entries.title: US turns up the heat on Middle East allies in bid to stop Russia's war machine
entries.description: As the Ukraine war approaches the one-year mark, the United States is ramping up efforts to choke off Russia's economy and it has set its sight on the Middle East.

entries.title: Extreme cold snaps: Why temperatures still plummet to dangerous levels even as the planet warms
entries.description: Even as the world smashes through one all-time heat record after another and speeds towards critical warming thresholds, brutal waves of deadly cold can still arrive in bomb cyclones that bring icy weather and deep snow -- and add fuel for those who deny the climate crisis is real or significant.

entries.title: Zelensky eyeing fast-track EU membership ahead of Kyiv summit, but likely to be disappointed
These Florida brothers ran one of the largest opioid 'pill mills' in US history. The FBI says it was linked to thousands of deaths
entries.description: Throngs of people hang outside the American Pain clinic in Boca Raton, Florida, waiting their turn. Inside, a doctor greets them one by one and prescribes them pain medication, a handgun peeking out from under his white coat.

entries.title: Is the Fed ignoring long Covid in its inflation fight?
entries.description: Federal Reserve officials have for months blamed a dwindling supply of US workers for elevated inflation levels. During his December press conference, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said that Covid-related deaths accounted for a large chunk of the structural labor shortage in the economy.

entries.title: Offices are more than 50% filled for the first time since the pandemic started
entries.description: Nearly three years after the pandemic began, American offices are finally more than halfway filled again as workers have gradually returned to the office.

entries.title: Pathological lying could finally be getting attention as a mental disorder
entries.description: When Timothy Levine set out to write a book about deception in 2016, he wanted to include a chapter on one of its most extreme forms: pathological lying.

entries.title: Olympic boycott could render the Games 'pointless' if Russian athletes compete, says Polish minister
entries.description: Allowing athletes from Russia and Belarus to compete at the Paris Olympics could lead to a large-scale boycott and render the Games "pointless," Poland's sports minister said on Thursday.

entries.title: Air raid alerts in Kyiv as EU leaders to hold summit with Zelensky
Gareth Bale stuns pro golfers with incredible cart path shot at Pebble Beach Pro-Am
entries.description: Few tuning in to watch the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am on Monday will have been surprised to learn that former Real Madrid star Gareth Bale is good at golf.

entries.title: Adani will ask Big 4 accounting firm for a 'general audit,' says TotalEnergies
entries.description: One of Gautam Adani's biggest international partners, TotalEnergies, said Friday that his Indian conglomerate is preparing to appoint a global accounting firm to conduct a "general audit" of its business.

entries.title: The US city that keeps changing the world
entries.description: There's something in the air in Seattle. And while at first sniff you might assume that it's coffee, nose a little harder and you'll notice that Seattle doesn't run on caffeine -- it runs on innovation.

entries.title: Tarek El Moussa and Heather Rae Young have had their first baby together
entries.description: Congratulations are in order for Tarek El Moussa and Heather Rae Young, who have welcomed their first child together.

entries.title: Families of US detainees in China urge Blinken to make them 'number one' priority on his trip
entries.description: Harrison Li and Katherine Swidan both worry they may never see their loved ones again.

entries.title: Having two starting Black quarterbacks in Super Bowl for first time is 'special,' says Patrick Mahomes
entries.description: Both Patrick Mahomes and Jalen Hurts spoke to the media on Thursday as they recognized the significance of being the first two Black quarterbacks to start in the same Super Bowl.

entries.title: Life-threatening cold has moved into the Northeast US as South reels from ice storm
entries.description: A brutal blast of dangerously cold winds is expected to sweep across the Northeast and New England on Friday, prompting officials to close schools and activate emergency plans as the region braces for record-breaking sub-zero temperatures.

entries.title: This man ran a marathon every day in 2022 but has no interest in world records
entries.description: It's little wonder Gary McKee has been nicknamed "marathon man." He ran one every day last year.

entries.title: LeBron James edges closer to NBA's all-time scoring record with 26 points in Los Angeles Lakers' win over Indiana Pacers
entries.description: LeBron James is now just 63 points away from Kareem Abdul-Jabbar's all-time NBA scoring record after putting up 26 points in the Los Angeles Lakers' 112-111 win over the Indiana Pacers.

entries.title: See suspected China spy balloon fly over US skies
entries.description: The US is tracking a suspected Chinese high-altitude surveillance balloon over the continental United States, defense officials said. CNN's Steven Jiang has more on Beijing's response to the discovery.

entries.title: 'Ambassadors of peace': Amputee football association brings together Sierra Leone's civil war survivors
entries.description: On a busy weekend in Freetown, Sierra Leone, dozens of people gather to watch an afternoon football match not unlike countless others you'd find anywhere else in the world. But there's one striking difference -- these players are all amputees.

entries.title: Ohio police fatally shot a man they say drove at them. Family says he was just trying to clean his dead grandmother's home
entries.description: Police investigating a burglary report in Ohio fatally shot a man they allege drove a minivan toward them -- an account disputed by his relatives, who say he didn't drive at them, and that he was just there to clean out his dead grandmother's apartment.

entries.title: The war for Donbas moves to a different phase as Russia pounds cities that civilians can't afford to leave
entries.description: Russia is bringing its war against Ukraine closer to the industrial cities of Donetsk with a series of missile strikes against densely populated areas.

entries.title: Neil deGrasse Tyson on UFOs and aliens in space
entries.description: CNN's Chris Wallace talks to astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson about life outside of Earth. Watch his interview with Chris Wallace February 5 at 7:00pm ET on CNN or anytime on HBO Max.

entries.title: Hong Kong is set to give away 500,000 free airline tickets to lure back tourists
Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios avoids conviction for assault
entries.description: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios has avoided a criminal conviction despite pleading guilty to assaulting his former girlfriend, CNN affiliate Nine News reported on Friday.

entries.title: Adani Group shares continue turbulent ride as Hindenburg rout deepens
entries.description: Shares in most Adani Group companies continued to plunge on Friday, as the embattled conglomerate grapples with stock market mayhem unleashed after a US short seller accused it of fraud.

entries.title: Russian missile strike on Kramatorsk sends terrified civilians scrambling to find shelter
Remember when Jennifer Lopez's Grammy Awards dress helped invent Google Image Search?
entries.description: More than two decades ago, Jennifer Lopez changed the internet forever when she wore a dress so striking it inspired engineers to build Google Image Search.

entries.title: Iranian film director Jafar Panahi goes on hunger strike in prison
entries.description: One of Iran's most influential filmmakers, Jafar Panahi, has reportedly gone on a hunger strike in Tehran's Evin prison to protest his continued detention.

entries.title: Kherson was liberated 12 weeks ago. See why it's still a ghost town
entries.description: The Ukrainian city of Kherson that was liberated 12 weeks ago is now almost a ghost town as Russians continue to bombard it. The emergency services live in fear of being targeted. CNN's Sam Kiley met some civilians seeking help.

entries.title: Analysis: Fears spark call for more Western arms for Ukraine
entries.description: Russia's mass mobilization, looming offensive and missile-borne terror against civilians is triggering fresh calls for even greater Western lethal aid to Ukraine, days after leaders signed off on their latest package that included the first tanks.

entries.title: Pentagon tracking suspected Chinese spy balloon over the US
What is a suspected Chinese spy balloon doing above the US?
entries.description: News that the Pentagon is monitoring a suspected Chinese surveillance balloon in the skies over the continental United States raises a series of questions -- not least among them, what exactly it might be doing.

entries.title: Former Russian fighter says he witnessed torture of Ukrainian prisoners of war
Analysis: Balloon drama is the worst possible lead up to expected Blinken visit to China
entries.description: It's hard to imagine a worse warm up for Secretary of State Antony Blinken's critical talks in Beijing, which are expected in the next few days, than news that a suspected Chinese spy balloon is floating merrily across the US.

entries.title: South Korea court rejects temple's claim to statue it says pirates pillaged
entries.description: A South Korean court on Wednesday rejected a Buddhist temple's claim to a statue that it said Japanese pirates looted in the 14th century, clearing the way for Japan to press for its return.

entries.title: Video shows scene in the 'eye of the storm' of Russia's invasion
entries.description: CNN's Frederick Pleitgen reports from Kramatorsk, Ukraine, where civilians are facing missile strikes from Russia.

entries.title: China and Russia are as close as ever, and that's a problem for the US
entries.description: When Antony Blinken touches down in Beijing in the coming days for the first visit to China by a US secretary of state since 2018, he will be cutting a stark contrast to the scene in the Chinese capital one year earlier.

entries.title: Celebrating the Lantern Festival, Lunar New Year's grand finale
entries.description: As this year's Lunar New Year celebrations draw to a close, it's time to get ready for the grand finale, a.k.a. the Lantern Festival.

entries.title: Why this retired Air Force colonel thinks a Chinese spy balloon was over Montana
entries.description: Col. Cedric Leighton, CNN military analyst and retired US Air Force colonel, tells CNN's Erin Burnett why he believes a Chinese spy balloon was spotted flying over Billings, Montana.

entries.title: Bolsonaro participated in a meeting to overturn election, Brazilian senator says
entries.description: A Brazilian senator says former President Jair Bolsonaro attended a meeting in December to overturn Brazil's 2022 presidential election results, which granted current leader Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva the presidency.

entries.title: Most US adults support banning sales of all tobacco products, CDC survey says
entries.description: More than half of US adults support ending the sale of all tobacco products, according to a new study led by researchers from the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, and nearly two-thirds said they support banning menthol cigarette sales.

entries.title: EU meeting on Ukraine membership sends 'very strong signal' to Russia
EU meeting on Ukraine membership sends 'very strong signal' to Russia
CNN receives exclusive look inside Myanmar 2 years into military coup
entries.description: CNN's Ivan Watson offers a rare look inside Myanmar two years after a military coup ousted democratically elected leader Aung San Suu Kyi.

entries.title: Tom Jones hit 'Delilah' banned from Wales rugby matches due to 'problematic' nature of song
entries.description: Choirs have been banned from performing Tom Jones' hit "Delilah" during Wales' international rugby matches at the Principality Stadium in Cardiff due to the song's "problematic" nature, the UK's PA Media reported.
